sets.name: IronPress
sets.description:
The combination of Iron Defense + Body Press lets Garganacl serve as a bulky and dangerous setup sweeper, allowing it to beat Pokemon it otherwise loses to, such as Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit. Salt Cure wears down common switch-ins such as Great Tusk, Gholdengo, Rotom-W, and Hatterene, as well as passive Pokemon like Toxapex and Corviknight, and forces them to burn recovery PP more often. Recover keeps Garganacl healthy throughout a game to check Pokemon like Ceruledge and Iron Moth and makes it more sustainable as a wincon. Purifying Salt prevents it from being crippled by Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Clodsire. It also provides a handy Ghost resistance, letting Garganacl potentially switch in on predicted Ghost-type moves from Pokemon like Dragapult and Skeledirge. Leftovers provides valuable passive recovery, reducing Garganacl's reliance on Recover. Maximum Special Defense EVs and a Careful nature maximize Garganacl's bulk, making it easier for Garganacl to switch in on Pokemon such as Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Dragapult and use them as setup fodder. Tera Water provides incredibly valuable resistances, letting Garganacl potentially check Gholdengo and Scizor while retaining its ability to pivot in on Fire-types like Cinderace. Tera Fairy allows Garganacl to turn the tables on Great Tusk and Sacred Sword Chien-Pao while also preventing Breloom from revenge killing it. However, this does remove its resistance to Fire, making it more susceptible to Pokemon like Skeledirge and Ceruledge. Tera Ghost prevents Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk from reliably revenge killing Garganacl, letting it use them as setup fodder. It does negate the Ghost resistance provided by Purifying Salt, however, so another switch-in to Dragapult's Shadow Ball should be used.

Checks to strong wallbreakers like Iron Valiant, Breloom, and Chien-Pao are good teammates; examples include the likes of Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Corviknight. While Garganacl is given a Ghost resistance from Purifying Salt, it cannot fully check Dragapult and Gholdengo prior to Terastallization, with the latter completely countering it if it uses Covert Cloak. As such, Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Clodsire make for great teammates. Pokemon like Corviknight and Scizor appreciate Garganacl checking Fire-types like Ceruledge and Skeledirge. Corviknight is notable in that it also forms a strong defensive core with Garganacl, checking Meowscarada for it. Entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and the aforementioned Corviknight are appreciated, as Garganacl is heavily pressured by entry hazards and cannot set up reliably if it is worn down. Frail, offensive Pokemon like Cinderace and Chien-Pao appreciate chip damage being forced onto their checks and having a strong defensive Pokemon to fall back on. Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Iron Valiant can pave the way for Garganacl to clean late-game, wearing down or significantly pressuring its checks in Gholdengo, Meowscarada, and Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Great Tusk.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• With Purifying Salt making it immune to status and Salt Cure providing useful chip damage, especially against Water- and Steel-types, Garganacl is a dangerous defensive setup Pokemon.

  • Body Press is the best option for consistency against offensive teams.

  • Fissure severely punishes passive play against Garganacl, at the cost of forcing it to rely on Salt Cure residual damage against offensive teams.

Tera Types

  • Flying: A Flying typing lets Garganacl take on formerly super effective attacks such as Earthquake and Close Combat while making it a reasonable check to most Breloom.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type stops Amoonguss from clearing its boosts with Clear Smog and makes Garganacl a decent check to Fairy-types such as offensive Mimikyu and Substitute + Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type gives Garganacl an immunity to Body Press, giving it the edge against Corviknight and opposing Garganacl, especially when paired with Leftovers.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: If using Tera Flying Garganacl, maximizing Special Defense is the best choice for easier setup.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: In addition to powering up Body Press, a focus on Defense makes setting up on powerful setup sweepers such as Dragonite an easier task.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 SpD with Careful: This EV spread allows Tera Steel Garganacl to avoid a 2HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch after Iron Defense.

sets.name: Salty Stall
sets.description:
• With some entry hazard support, this Garganacl can be very difficult to outstall, thanks to the constant passive damage from Salt Cure.

  • Protect not only scouts for surprise Tera types, but it also goes well with the passive healing from Leftovers.

  • Substitute makes Garganacl even more difficult to properly switch into, providing protection against Trick, OHKO moves, and opposing Salt Cure.

  • Garganacl's great bulk makes it a prime candidate for fishing with Fissure itself, though its low PP can be an issue in mirror matches.

  • Since this set benefits so much from Stealth Rock support, running it on its own is a reasonable sacrifice if Garganacl needs to be more self-sufficient.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Tera Flying gets rid of the Ground and Fighting weaknesses, and it makes Fissure no longer an issue.

  • Ghost: While removing Purifying Salt's Ghost resistance is a shame, Tera Ghost does wonderfully against Corviknight and opposing Garganacl due to the Body Press immunity.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Garganacl a better matchup against Gholdengo thanks to the Make It Rain resistance.

  • Grass: Tera Grass gives Garganacl a much easier time against Rotom-W and Palafin-H.

vgc2023.overview:
• Garganacl is a powerful IronPress sweeper with its great bulk and Terastallization options; Iron Defense turns Body Press into a weapon and makes it incredibly difficult to take down. Salt Cure is an amazing complement to IronPress, as it can wear down Pokemon immune or resistant to Body Press like Annihilape, Ceruledge, and Pelipper.

  • Garganacl dislikes Haze and Clear Smog users like Murkrow and Amoonguss, which can reset its Defense boosts. Armarouge checks Amoonguss and can set Trick Room for Garganacl. Murkrow is easily taken advantage of by Sylveon. Powerful special attackers like Armarouge, Hydreigon, and Sylveon can overpower Garganacl with some help, especially if it's the last Pokemon standing; this situation will often happen, since Garganacl is slow to set up and gives the opponent freedom in beating down teammates.

  • A moveset of Body Press, Wide Guard, Salt Cure, and Recover with Rocky Helmet does very well against Lycanroc + Tyranitar teams. Wide Guard prevents Lycanroc and Tyranitar from repeatedly using Rock Slide with impunity, and Rocky Helmet can break Lycanroc's Focus Sash, leaving it likely KOed by Body Press. Wide Guard can also be helpful against Trick Room teams, as it blocks Torkoal's Eruption and Armarouge's spread Expanding Force.

sets.name: IronPress Sweeper
sets.description:
• Purifying Salt protects Garganacl from status moves like Amoonguss's Spore and Rotom-W's Will-O-Wisp.

  • The EV spread slightly optimizes Special Defense and helps Garganacl against special attackers like Armarouge and Hydreigon. Garganacl isn't outspeeding much of anything, so it might as well aim to underspeed opposing Trick Room Pokemon; minimum Speed lets Garganacl Speed tie Mudsdale while easily underspeeding Kingambit and Hariyama.

  • Tera Ghost gives Garganacl an immunity to Fighting and leaves it with effectively just one weakness, since Purifying Salt halves the power of Ghost-type attacks. Tera Grass prevents Amoonguss from redirecting Garganacl's Body Press via Rage Powder, and its Water and Electric resistances are helpful against Rotom-W. Tera Steel gives Garganacl a plethora of resistances like Dragon, Grass, Fairy, and Steel, which are helpful against Pokemon like Hydreigon, Meowscarada, Gholdengo, and Sylveon, and it makes Garganacl immune to Amoonguss's Clear Smog.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Garganacl is great physically defensive wall, able to check many strong attackers such as Aerilate Dragonite, Sword of Ruin Baxcalibur, and Orichalcum Pulse Ceruledge. Salt Cure is Garganacl's main method of damage, as it aggressively accrues chip damage on would-be switch-ins like Corviknight, Iron Treads, and opposing Garganacl. Body Press makes use of Garganacl's high Defense stat, threatening Pokemon such as Kingambit and Chi-Yu, while Stealth Rock takes advantage of the free turns Garganacl gets from switching into Pokemon like Dragonite. Iron Defense can be used alongside Body Press for more safety against Swords Dance users like Ceruledge and Iron Hands. Protect is an option to scout Choice-locked foes and increase the amount of recovery from Leftovers. Since Fur Coat Garganacl is weak to many special attackers such as Iron Bundle, Pokemon that can switch into these threats, such as Ice Scales Corviknight, make great partners. Strong wallbreakers such as Choice Specs Iron Bundle and Baxcalibur are also good teammates, as they greatly appreciate the damage that Garganacl forces onto walls like Ice Scales Corviknight and Fur Coat Iron Hands.

sets.name: Ice Scales
sets.description: Ice Scales Garganacl is an excellent specially defensive Pokemon, able to switch into threatening wallbreakers such as Desolate Land Iron Moth, Chi-Yu, and Aerilate Noivern. Salt Cure forces out the many Fire- and Flying-types that Garganacl switches in on, and its passive damage helps wear down the opposing team. Protect eases prediction against Choice-locked Pokemon and pairs well with Leftovers, while Iron Defense makes Garganacl an emergency check to physical attackers such as Aerilate Dragonite. Garganacl is weak to strong Water-types such as Iron Bundle, so teammates immune to Water such as Desolate Land Volcarona are good parters. Physically defensive Pokemon such as Fur Coat Clodsire are necessary teammates, as Garganacl is forced out by physical wallbreakers such as Great Tusk and Iron Hands. Strong offensive Pokemon such as Baxcalibur and Dragonite can take advantage of the damage Salt Cure forces onto defensive Pokemon, like opposing Garganacl and Fur Coat Hippowdon.

vgc2023.overview:
• Armarouge is an amazing Trick Room setter and powerful offensive Pokemon. Few Pokemon resist Psychic + Fire, and Armor Cannon and Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain are very powerful attacks. With minimum Speed, Armarouge in Trick Room outpaces a large portion of the metagame.

  • Armarouge appreciates Pokemon that can help it set Trick Room, like Choice Scarf Annihilape thanks to Final Gambit, and redirectors such as Amoonguss and Indeedee-F; Indeedee-F is a particularly good teammate due to Psychic Surge massively improving Expanding Force.

  • Hydreigon, Garchomp, and Tyranitar are all strong and common Pokemon that can give Armarouge a hard time. Fighting-type teammates like Hariyama, Paldean Tauros-W, and Annihilape help check Hydreigon and Tyranitar. Garchomp can be checked by Pokemon like Rotom-W, Abomasnow, and Tera Steel Hydreigon.

sets.name: Trick Room
sets.description:
• Armor Cannon is a nuclear single-target attack that can OHKO Amoonguss, OHKO Kingambit, and even give a good shot to 2HKO Grimmsnarl through Light Screen. Alternatively, Heat Wave is a strong spread move option alongside Life Orb, which compensates for its considerably lower power than Armor Cannon. Being a spread move, it doesn't mind redirection users like Rage Powder Amoonguss or make Armarouge choose between targeting one of two Protect users.

  • Psychic is used when not paired with Indeedee-F. Expanding Force is preferred alongside Indeedee-F, which makes Expanding Force much stronger and a spread move via Psychic Terrain.

  • Wide Guard protects Armarouge and its teammates from attacks like Garchomp's Earthquake and Tyranitar's Rock Slide. Energy Ball lets Armarouge OHKO Rotom-W and TeraGround Garchomp with Tera Grass,and it has a good chance to 2HKO Tyranitar with Life Orb, even without Terastallizing. Aura Sphere 2HKOes Hydreigon and Tyranitar, and with Life Orb, it OHKOes them with minimal damage.

  • Life Orb makes Armarouge very powerful, securing OHKOs against Pokemon like Maushold, slightly chipped Hatterene, and, with Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain, slightly chipped Garchomp and Rotom-W. Safety Goggles grants Armarouge immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder.

  • A Grass Tera type gives Armarouge Ground and Water resistances, which are good against Garchomp and Rotom-W. Tera Dark is a good option to improve matchups against Ghost- and Psychic-types like Ceruledge, Skeledirge, and opposing Armarouge, make Armarouge immune to Prankster Murkrow's Taunt, and give it a resistance to Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Dark Pulse can be used alongside Tera Dark to more heavily damage Ghost- and Psychic-types, though outside of opposing Armarouge, Life Orb Psychic can usually 2HKO them.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Choice Scarf Armarouge is a passable revenge killer that outspeeds naturally fast Pokemon like Iron Bundle, Noivern, and Iron Valiant, threatening them with its high-Base Power STAB attacks. Moreover, it can clean up late-game easily thanks to Psychic Surge, which protects it from common priority attacks such as Dragonite's Extreme Speed, Slither Wing's First Impression, and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Trick cripples bulky foes it can't immediately threaten, especially Ice Scale users like Blissey, Florges, and Garganacl. Focus Blast hits Chi-Yu and Roaring Moon, while Psyshock 2HKOes Ice Scales Clodsire. Utility moves in Destiny Bond and Will-O-Wisp can also be used, with the former checking setup sweepers like Baxcalibur and Dragonite and the latter punishing switch-ins. Mold Breaker wallbreakers like Iron Bundle can overwhelm shared checks in Ice Scales users and appreciate Armarouge's Psychic Terrain protecting them from the likes of Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak and Dragonite's Extreme Speed. Armarouge's susceptibility to entry hazards makes teammates like Defog Corviknight and Rapid Spin Great Tusk valuable options.

sets.name: Focus Sash Attacker
sets.description:
• With a stellar offensive typing, a unique set of attacks, Weak Armor allowing it to outspeed a large part of the metagame, and its immunity to Extreme Speed and Mach Punch, Ceruledge proves itself to be a very solid Focus Sash option.

  • Bitter Blade's recovery can make Focus Sash usable even if entry hazards chip it. If Ceruledge is brought down to 1 HP, a +2 Bitter Blade can heal it to the point that it can tank an extra attack.

  • Close Combat hits the Normal-, Dark-, and Rock-types that resist Ceruledge's STAB combination. Still, Shadow Claw is a noteworthy choice to guarantee the KO on Mimikyu and let Ceruledge pressure Skeledirge. Note, however, that maximum Defense Skeledirge can recover more than Shadow Claw's damage, barring critical hits, and a Terastallized Skeledirge can completely wall this set.

  • As powerful as Swords Dance boosted attacks from Ceruledge are, the abundance of Unaware Pokemon, primarily Dondozo, has made some players opt to use Destiny Bond to attempt Dondozo—makes Destiny Bond viable to snag surprise kills. KOs. Destiny Bond can also make the matchup against KOing common Sucker Punch Pokemon, such as Meowscarada and Kingambit, easier to win without having to rely on predictions. less prediction reliant.

  • Adamant's added damage output is valuable, but Jolly allows Ceruledge to outspeed non-Scarf Gholdengo, and gives it a chance at outspeeding Modest Rotom formes and Glimmora. All of the mentioned examples are Special Attackers, meaning Ceruledge's Weak Armor often does not trigger in these matchups.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Giving Bitter Blade an extra push in damage is quite useful, giving Ceruledge more recovery.

  • Normal: Normal is an exceedingly common Tera Type on Ghost types due to the immunity it brings to the table. Ceruledge makes particularly excellent use of Normal Tera by resisting both Steel and Fairy, making it very difficult for Gholdengo and Mimikyu to click anything other than a Ghost type move when facing off against Ceruledge.

  • Fighting: Giving extra reach pwer to Close Combat, a powerful option against Pokemon such as Hydreigon, makes Fighting a solid choice for a Tera Type.

sets.name: Bulk Up Sweeper
sets.description:
• Bulk Up Ceruledge makes excellent use of both Ceruledge's respectable bulk and Bitter Blade's high recovery. By changing its typing to a more defense oriented one, while maintaining the Fire immunity thanks to Flash Fire, Ceruledge can set up Bulk Ups on a variety of common Pokemon, ranging from Corviknight, Kingambit, Azumarill and Gholdengo.

  • Taunt lets Ceruledge set up Bulk Up without needing to fear common phasing moves (with the exception of attacking moves such as Dragon Tail), as well as opposing setup moves such opposing Bulk Up and Iron Defense, provided you outspeed.

  • Priority of some form is always nice to have on a Pokemon, which makes Shadow Sneak an easy contender for the last move. Gaining extra added strength against Pokemon such as Dragapult and Annihilape is certainly charming.

  • Grass Tera Blast allows Ceruledge to eliminate Dondozo more quickly. While Taunt can shut down Dondozo's Yawn, it cannot shut down Fissure. The only way to beat Dondozo would be to eliminate it as quickly as possibly, which Grass Tera Blast aids with.

  • Flame Charge provides Ceruledge an extra net of safety against potential Scarf users and Annihilape, who are capable of turning the tides against it. While normally, Ceruledge is prone to faster Taunt + Bulk Up users and Scarfed Trick, Flame Charge helps mitigate both of those weaknesses.

  • Will-O-Wisp is a good option to let Ceruledge be a status spreader in games where it can't set up as easily. It also helps Ceruledge set up more easily against threats such as Unaware Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Grass: An immunity to Spore and a resistance to Water makes Grass the most notable Tera type for this set. Flash Fire eliminating one of Grass's many weaknesses is also noteworthy.

  • Fire: Increasing Bitter Blade's power will always be a valuable trait. Eliminating Ghost's weaknesses to Ghost and Dark also allows Ceruledge to set up more comfortably.

  • Bug: Tera Bug is similar to Tera Grass, but in exchange for losing the Water resistance and maintaining the Rock weakness of Fire / Ghost, Ceruledge can tank Volcarona's Bug Buzz with significantly more ease.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def with Impish: Investing into Defense prepares Ceruledge and its mediocre physical bulk for the physical-biased metagame. Bulk Up will boost its Defense, but it can struggle to take some physical hits even after a boost, and its special bulk is naturally high.

  • 252 HP / 252 Spe with Jolly: A faster spread helps Ceruledge outspeed other Bulk Up users, like Annihilape opting to invest in bulk. Being faster, more often than not, lets Ceruledge win these matchups with ease.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD with Careful: While most threats in the metagame at the moment are physical, a specially defensive spread is still noteworthy for its ability to surprise Hydreigons. Hydreigon.

vgc2023.overview:
• Ceruledge is a strong Bulk Up sweeper in Series 1. The combination of Bulk Up's Defense boost and Bitter Blade's healing help Ceruledge stay healthy during a sweep.

  • Ceruledge's unique defensive qualities let it set up in the face of Pokemon like Torkoal, Maushold, and Arcanine, and Tera Grass lets it set up against even more Pokemon. Pokemon that can help Ceruledge set up like Rage Powder Amoonguss can make good teammates.

  • Ceruledge struggles against some of the metagame's best Pokemon like Hydreigon, Tyranitar, and Garchomp. Paldean Tauros-A, Sylveon, and Pawmot check Hydreigon and Tyranitar for Ceruledge. Tera Steel Hydreigon, Rotom-W, and Abomasnow check Garchomp.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Shadow Sneak finishes off weakened Pokemon, Focus Sash users like Kilowattral, hits opposing Ceruledge, and lets Ceruledge revenge kill Ghost-weak Pokemon like Gholdengo. Tera Blast + Tera Grass lets Ceruledge hit Fire-resistant Pokemon like Tyranitar, Rotom-W, and Garchomp.

  • Clear Amulet prevents Ceruledge from being weakened by Intimidate users like Paldean Tauros-A, Arcanine, and Gyarados, as well as Parting Shot Grimmsnarl.

  • Grass is easily Ceruledge's best Tera type, giving it a Water and Ground resistance for the likes of Garchomp and Rotom-W and making it immune to Amoonguss's powder moves. Flash Fire lets Ceruledge do extremely well against opposing Fire-types, especially when Terastallized, as it will shed its weakness to super effective coverage moves like Torkoal's Earth Power and opposing Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Ceruledge is an incredibly powerful wallbreaker due to its potent offensive typing, boosted Fire-type attacks, and stellar coverage. Shadow Sneak makes up for Ceruledge's lackluster Speed and can finish off faster Pokemon. Solar Blade and Close Combat provide coverage against foes that tank Ceruledge's STAB moves, such as Garganacl, Great Tusk, Chi-Yu, and Roaring Moon. Alternatively, Will-O-Wisp gives up coverage for the ability to cripple switch-ins like Fur Coat Garchomp and Hippowdon. Orichalcum Pulse is the preferred ability due to the Attack bonus, but Desolate Land provides it with some defensive utility by checking opposing Primordial Sea users. Due to Ceruledge's frailty, it appreciates pivoting and entry hazard removal from teammates like Corviknight, Great Tusk, and Iron Treads. Strong special attackers such as Iron Bundle can pair with Ceruledge to break down each other's checks, such as Fur Coat Garganacl and Garchomp and Blissey and Ice Scales Corviknight, respectively.

sets.name: Choiced Attacker
sets.description: Ceruledge's sun-boosted Bitter Blade offers a combination of power and longevity scarcely seen in a wallbreaker. Choice Band Bitter Blade 2HKOes the majority of the metagame, while Choice Scarf Ceruledge outpaces Iron Bundle and Dragapult. Close Combat hits Garganacl and Well-Baked Body Steel-types, and Solar Blade hits Great Tusk. Will-O-Wisp cripples many of Ceruledge's switch-ins, such as Garganacl and Fur Coat Iron Hands. On Choice Band sets, a Jolly Nature is useful for outpacing opposing Ceruledge and Gholdengo. The additional power offered by Orichalcum Pulse guarantees the OHKO against Dragapult with Choice Scarf Shadow Claw, but Desolate Land can be used to offensively check Iron Bundle. Ceruledge's Stealth Rock weakness and lackluster bulk make Defog and pivot support from a teammate like Corviknight very valuable. Great Tusk's offensive presence and Knock Off support greatly complements Ceruledge's own offensive prowess and burn spreading capabilities; defensive cores can quickly crumble under the weight of entry hazards, burn chip, and repeated subjection to Bitter Blade and Headlong Rush. Fast special attackers like Iron Bundle and Dragapult help deal with faster threats and Garganacl.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Fat Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt's stats allow it to be deceptively bulky, and a pure Electric typing is not terrible on a defensive Pokemon with reliable recovery and pivoting.

  • Parabolic Charge gives Bellibolt a more constant stream of recovery, though it is much less punishing than Discharge.

  • Volt Switch maintains initiative when predicting switches after bringing Bellibolt in on something that it walls, such as defensive Gholdengo or Corviknight.

  • Chilling Water punishes Garchomp and Hippowdon on the switch-in.

  • Thunder Wave disrupts opponents if Bellibolt doesn't have Discharge.

  • Tera Blast hits common Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Baxcaliber after Terastallizing into the Fairy typing.

  • Soak catches Electric resistant foes on the switch-in and forces them to either switch out or Terastallize early, with major targets including Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Terastallizing into the Grass typing flips the matchup against Ground-types on its head, turning their attacks from super effective into a resisted hit while still charging Bellibolt's next Electric hit; this allows Bellibolt to wall Hippowdon and Garchomp and absorb Spores vs Breloom and Amoonguss, effectively walling them as well.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type comfortably walls Dragon-types, removing a lot of their offensive pressure.

  • Water: Water is just generally good to have as a defensive Tera type. It also gives Bellibolt STAB on Chilling Water for slightly more damage.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to live two Glaive Rushes from Adamant Baxcalibur if it is not in a position to Terastallize. The physical bulk lets Bellibolt always survive Life Orb Garchomp's Earthquake, and after Terastallization into a neutral type, it becomes a 3HKO. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed Hippowdon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers provides long term passive recovery alongside Slack Off, which can make Bellibolt very difficult to remove. Leftovers also removes any chance of a 2HKO from powerful physical threats such as Baxcalibur.

  • Sitrus Berry: A short-term HP booster that effectively gives Bellibolt 125% HP, making it a good back-up option if Leftovers is already in use.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet Bellibolt can switch into and punish physical attackers in a more passive manner; the chip damage can also break Focus Sash and weaken things into range of Electromorphosis-boosted attacks.

sets.name: Tactical Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt can be quite unassuming, and specially offensive Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Rotom may see it as a free opportunity to get into position. Assault Vest turns the tides against them with Electromorphosis + Parabolic Charge, which makes Bellibolt seem impossible to remove for certain Pokemon.

  • Tera Blast is important coverage to have; with a Fairy Tera type, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragons.

  • Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric for much-needed coverage. Alternatively, Chilling Water weakens common switch-ins such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur, allowing you to reposition your team more safely.

  • Acid Spray threatens non-Steel type switch-ins and also allows Bellibolt to effectively use it’s ability without having to take damage first. Its also a powerful tool against Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

  • Sucker Punch catches Focus Sash Pokemon and/or deals chip damage on turns where Bellibolt is guaranteed to go down.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Fairy Tera Bellibolt offensively checks big threats like Hydreigon and Dragapult by walling their non-Tera sets and nabbing surprise KO's.

  • Grass-type: Grass Tera Bellibolt can stay in versus common Pokemon such as Hippowdon can Breloom, sponge their attacks, and either chunk them or survive and reposition.

  • Electric-type: Maximizing Parabolic Charge damage is a viable option.

EV Spreads

  • ** 228 HP / 28 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 28 Spe**: This spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Rotom-W and Hydreigon's Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor, respectively. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed Hippowdon. 28 Defense EVs are enough for Bellibolt to survive Focus Sash Garchomp's Earthquake, which notably becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into into a typing without a weakness to Ground.

sets.name: Bespectacled Bellibolt
sets.description:
• With such good natural bulk, Bellibolt can easily survive hits from common threats and nab surprise KO's in return with a cheeky Choice Specs set.

  • Discharge or Thunderbolt is the preferred primary STAB move, as either one takes advantage of Choice Specs more than Parabolic Charge. With an Electromorphosis boost, Bellibolt can 2HKO common switch-ins without having to Terastallize, like Dragapult.

  • Tera Blast is important for coverage; with a Fairy typing you reliably check non-Tera Steel Dragons. Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric.

  • Muddy Water lets Bellibolt win the one-on-one against Hippowdon. Parabolic Charge should be used if run Tera Electric with Muddy Water already available in a different moveslot.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy let Bellibolt turn the tables on bulky Dragon-types such as Baxcalibur by scoring a surprise KO on a potential setup attempt.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass turns Bellibolt's only weakness into a resistance and gets surprise OHKOs on threats such as physically defensive Hippowdon.

  • Electric-type: Tera Electric + Choice Specs turns Bellibolt into an offensive behemoth, and with an Electromorphosis boost it can OHKO resists like Dragapult and Hydreigon and specially defensive Pokemon, such as specially defensive Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 196 SpA / 28 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive Choice Specs Draco Meteor from Hydreigon and Earthquake from Focus Sash Garchomp; Garchomp's Earthquake becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground. The Speed EVs outspeed 4 Speed Hippowdon, while the SpA EVs are enough to OHKO physically defensive Hippowdon with Muddy Water.

vgc2023.overview:
• Kilowattrel stands out as one of the best Tailwind setters in the current metagame. Its base 125 Speed stat lets it set Tailwind first, with very little Prankster Tailwind Pokemon stopping it from doing so.

  • Kilowattrel has a respectable base 105 Special Attack stat and a good offensive typing, allowing it to tackle the likes of Meowscarada and Gyarados well.

  • Kilowattrel appreciates immediately hard-hitting partners such as Choice Specs Gholdengo and Garchomp to break through opposing teams. Gholdengo is great in particular thanks to its immunity to Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Kilowattrel is particularly frail, meaning it often only gets to set Tailwind and fire off a single attack before it faints. It also means in late-game scenarios, it is unreliable at dueling the meta's most common attackers like Gholdengo and Hydreigon.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Air Slash is Kilowattrel's primary Flying-type STAB move of choice due to its higher accuracy than Hurricane, though the latter may be seen on rain teams.

  • Discharge is a good spread option when next to a Ground- or Electric-type partner like Garchomp or Rotom-F. Volt Switch allows Kilowattrel to use its high base Speed to pivot into a partner that can better use the extra Speed from Tailwind.

  • Competitive acts as an Intimidate-deterrent for physically attacking partners such as Garchomp, Baxcalibur, and Ceruledge.

  • Focus Sash is a must-have, as Kilowattrel is incredibly frail and unable to take any super effective or strong neutral attacks such as Baxcalibur's Icicle Crash and Tera Normal Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Kilowattrel rarely Terastallizes, but when it does, it prefers to use same type Tera to boost the power of one of its STAB moves.

sets.name: Offensive Pivot
sets.description:
Poison Touch is used to give Grafaiai a chance to poison while using Knock Off or U-turn. Black Sludge should be used if using Switcheroo to let it cripple switch-ins such as Tinkaton and Gastrodon; Heavy-Duty Boots are otherwise preferable to stay healthier versus Gengar when entry hazards are up.

Grafaiai should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is necessary to check Gengar and it will be unable to break past any checks even after powering up its Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Prankster Utility
sets.description:
Prankster lets Grafaiai use a priority Parting Shot versus faster targets such as Noivern and Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks. It can also trap certain Pokemon such as Salamence and Gengar into moves such as Dragon Dance and Substitute, respectively, with Encore.

Grafaiai should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is necessary to check Gengar and it will be unable to break past any checks even after powering up its Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
• With Calm Mind and Speed Boost rapidly increasing Stored Power's damage output, Espathra is a dangerous wincon against bulkier teams, as it even overwhelms Unaware foes.

  • Dazzling Gleam provides coverage against Dark-types such as Hydreigon.

  • Protect is the most reliable way to get a free turn of Speed Boost.

  • Substitute is a riskier option for Speed Boost stalling, but it severely punishes passive Pokemon and works extremely well on dual screen teams.

  • Lumina Crash with Life Orb or Focus Sash is an alternative option for dealing with Unaware foes much more quickly, giving Dondozo fewer chances to use Fissure and sweeping far more quickly, at the cost of being less reliable to set up.

  • The given EV spread allows Espathra to outspeed Meowscarada after one turn of Speed Boost.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type makes setting up on Hydreigon a much more realistic scenario and severely punishes Choice-locked Dragon-types like Dragapult.

  • Fighting: When paired with Tera Blast, Tera Fighting is Espathra's only hope of defeating Kingambit.

  • Dark: Tera Dark provides gives Espathra a valuable Shadow Sneak resistance and does a better shot of defeating weakened Gholdengo.

sets.name: Speed Passer
sets.description:
• Espathra is the only option for the coveted Speed Boost + Baton Pass combination, which can be extremely deadly for setting up sweeps!

  • Lumina Crash ensures that Espathra isn't totally shut down by Taunt, and the guaranteed -2 Special Defense drop helps against Unaware walls.

  • While most Pokemon love getting Baton Pass boosts, especially consider Pokemon that resist Espathra's common weaknesses, such as Hydreigon, Sylveon, and Kingambit.

  • The given EV spread outspeeds Choice Scarf Hydreigon after one turn of Speed Boost.

Tera Types

  • Espathra should usually avoid Terastallizing if possible, since its point is to help other Pokemon sweep. Consider these two options as fairly situational.

  • Ghost: Ghost Tera type makes Espartha immune to Extreme Speed, making passing against Dragonite much easier.

  • Normal: With a Normal Tera type, Espartha can set up against its Ghost types and isn't worried about Shadow Sneak anymore.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is the easy option to recommend since it pairs well with Protect and Substitute.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry should be used if Espathra is planning on passing Speed to teammates that want Leftovers, such as Skeledirge and Garganacl.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is the best way to guarantee passing at least one Speed boost, though it's a lackluster option for passing multiple boosts compared to other items.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description: Tera Ghost lets Tinkaton spinblock, check Slither Wing, and surprise Pokemon like Tyranitar trying to hit it with Earthquake. It is, however, undesirable to Terastillize Tinkaton, due to needing its typing to check a wide range of threats such as Grafaiai, Noivern, and Maushold.

sets.name: Swords Dance + Two Attacks
sets.description:
Protect lets Tinkaton freely use Gigaton Hammer multiple times, rack up extra passive recovery, and scout moves from Choice-locked Pokemon such as Slither Wing. Encore is an option that locks Pokemon such as Quagsire and Gastrodon into their recovery move, generating free turns.

Tera Dark lets Tinkaton eat a hit from Choice Specs Gengar more comfortably and removes its Ground weakness, which helps against Gastrodon and Quagsire. It is, however, undesirable to Terastillize Tinkaton, due to needing its typing to check a wide range of threats such as Grafaiai, Noivern, and Maushold.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description:
• Tinkaton boasts an impressive support movepool alongside a fantastic typing in Fairy / Steel.

  • Encore can open up opportunities for teammates, locking foes into status moves or attacks that a teammate resists.

  • With Mold Breaker, Tinkaton is capable of paralyzing Gholdengo and Garganacl with Thunder Wave.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Fire Tera turns Tinkaton's Fire-type weakness into a resistance, allowing it to use Encore on Volcarona.

  • Flying: Flying Tera makes Tinkaton immune to Ground, which can be useful in avoiding Earthquake from the likes of Garchomp and Tera Ground Baxcalibur.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 164 Def / 20 SpD / 76 Spe with Careful: The HP and Defense investment lets Tinkaton survive Adamant Dragonite's Earthquake into Extreme Speed. The Special Defense investment allows Tinkaton to survive one Timid Choice Specs Fire Blast from Hydreigon, two Modest Choice Specs Shadow Balls from Dragapult, and three uninvested Shadow Balls from Gholdengo. The Speed investment allows Tinkaton to outspeed a paralyzed non-Choice Scarf Hydreigon.

Items

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon lets Tinkaton set up Stealth Rock against other common entry hazard setters such as Garchomp and Glimmora without the use of Flying Tera and pairs incredibly well with Encore.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash allows Tinkaton to get a Thunder Wave off even against powerful attacks from the likes of Terastallized Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Dragapult.

sets.name: Offensive Support
sets.description:
• Despite Tinkaton's low offensive stats, it can still perform as an offensive Pokemon thanks to Gigaton Hammer's enormous 160 Base Power and Swords Dance.

  • Encore is a fantastic support move, potentially locking foes into resisted moves after a switch-in or denying slower, bulkier foes their recovery moves for a few turns.

  • Thanks to Mold Breaker, Tinkaton can hit Unaware Dondozo with boosted Play Rough, but Knock Off is valuable for removing held items.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Flying Tera turns Tinkaton's Ground-type weakness into an immunity, allowing it to use Encore on moves like Earthquake and Fissure from foes such as Garchomp and Dondozo.

  • Steel: Steel Tera capitalizes on Gigaton Hammer to make it deal as much damage as possible.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 236 Atk / 36 Def / 4 SpD / 228 Spe with Jolly: This spread outspeeds Annihilape and allows Tinkaton to survive a +1 Dragon Claw + Normal Tera Extreme Speed from Dragonite after Terastallizing.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers has great synergy with Encore, allowing it to set up while healing off some of the damage from weak moves.

  • Focus Sash: Holding a Focus Sash guarantees that Tinkaton can get at least one move off even against super effective attacks aimed at it.

vgc2023.overview:
• Tinkaton is primarily a bulky attacker, but it also has an amazing defensive typing and Fake Out, giving it good defensive utility.

  • Tinkaton does extremely well against Murkrow teams, including Pokemon common on them like Annihilape, Hydreigon, Meowscarada, Maushold, and Murkrow itself. This makes it a very good partner for Dondozo + Tatsugiri teams, which feel pressured by Murkrow's Haze. Many of the aforementioned Pokemon are also very common on teams without Murkrow, so Tinkaton checking them well is broadly useful.

  • Mold Breaker + Fake Out Tinkaton does well against dedicated Trick Room teams because its Fake Out bypasses Oranguru's Inner Focus and Farigiraf's Armor Tail, and it can OHKO Mimikyu through Disguise.

  • Tinkaton struggles with the extremely common Fire-types, as well as Garchomp and Steel-types like Corviknight and Scizor, which wall it entirely. Water-types help deal with the majority of its counters, especially Rotom-W.

sets.name: Bulky Attacker
sets.description:
• Knock Off hits Pokemon that resist both its STAB moves like Gholdengo, Armarouge, and Ceruledge and can cripple Pokemon with the item removal, especially Dondozo.

  • Tinkaton has many opportunities to use Swords Dance, especially because opponents will often use Protect consecutively in front of it, expecting a Fake Out or Gigaton Hammer. It's also a good move to use on the Gigaton Hammer recharge turns.

  • Assault Vest turns Tinkaton into a sponge against special attackers, which helps against common Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Gholdengo.

  • Sitrus Berry lets Tinkaton run Protect, which helps it stall out Gigaton Hammer recharge turns. This also pairs well with Swords Dance, which is similarly convenient to have on the recharge turns.

  • Mold Breaker is mainly good when used with Fake Out, as the ability lets Tinkaton flinch Dragonite, Farigiraf, and Oranguru. Mold Breaker also bypasses Mimikyu's Disguise.

  • Own Tempo is valuable because there are multiple good Intimidate users: Arcanine and Gyarados, as well as Paldean Tauros-A, Paldean Tauros-B, and Salamence. If you're not very worried about dedicated Trick Room teams or Dragonite, this is a good way to improve your matchup against bulkier teams.

  • Tera Steel is by far the best Tera type for Tinkaton, as it makes Gigaton Hammer very powerful, even doing good damage to targets that resist it. For example, it 2HKOes maximum HP Talonflame.

sets.name: RegenVest
sets.description: Tinkaton's decent bulk with Assault Vest and incredible defensive typing allow it to pivot into and check special attackers such as Noivern and Dragapult lacking a Fire-type move. Knock Off is Tinkaton's most important move, as it hits Gholdengo and removes crucial items from common switch-ins such as Corviknight, Skeledirge, and Iron Treads. Skitter Smack lowers the Special Attack of bulky Calm Mind users such as Fur Coat Florges and powerful wallbreakers such as Chi-Yu and Iron Bundle, allowing Tinkaton and its teammates to more easily handle these threats. Play Rough and Ice Hammer both hit Dragon-types such as Roaring Moon and Dragapult hard; Play Rough also dents Fighting-types such as Slither Wing while Ice Hammer deals huge damage to Garchomp, Dragonite, and Clodsire. Physically defensive walls such as Hippowdon can deal with the physical wallbreakers that threaten Tinkaton, like Ceruledge and Great Tusk, and appreciate it relieving pressure against Iron Bundle. Slower attackers such as Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Quaquaval benefit from Tinkaton handling fast revenge killers such as Noivern and Dragapult for them.

sets.name: This looks like a job for Palafin
sets.description:
• Palafin's stats are middling, but after switching out once it will forme change into Palafin-H, which boasts the highest base Attack in the format, making it an effective wall breaker and revenge killer.

  • Flip Turn enables Palafin to switch out and Transform into Palafin-H.

  • Jet Punch is a powerful priority move that enables Palafin-H to revenge kill.

  • Wave Crash is the highest Base Power STAB move Palafin-H has access to, but be wary of the recoil.

  • Close Combat is good coverage, hitting Rotom-W for neutral damage and hitting Arboliva and Meowscarada for super effective damage, all of which resist Palafin-H's STAB moves.

  • An Adamant nature increases the damage Wave Crash and Jet Punch inflict, making Palafin-H a more effective wall breaker and revenge killer. A Jolly nature enables Palafin-H to outspeed Mimikyu and Hydreigon.

Tera Types

  • Water: A Water Tera type boosts Jet Punch and Wave Crash, making Palafin-H a potent late-game cleaner.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type turns all of Palafin-H's weaknesses into resistances, giving it a favorable matchup against Rotom-W, and making it immune to Spore from Breloom.

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: Shed Tail, Regenerator, and good Speed give Cyclizar a unique role on offensive teams: safely bringing in powerful attackers like Dragapult, Iron Valiant, and Dragonite multiple times per battle. Draco Meteor KOes opposing Dragapult and Cyclizar and picks off weakened foes. U-turn lets Cyclizar pivot out without self-damage, healing from Regenerator to potentially use Shed Tail again later. Rapid Spin and/or Knock Off provide further utility. Choice Scarf + Shed Tail is preferred against Chien-Pao, Iron Bundle, Dragapult, and other fast threats, but Heavy-Duty Boots can be used to avoid entry hazard damage and the Choice lock. On Choice Scarf sets, 24 Special Attack EVs are enough to OHKO Dragapult with Draco Meteor. Cyclizar benefits greatly from a strong physical wall or Dazzling user to deal with priority attackers like Dragonite; strong attackers like Dragapult and Iron Valiant are valuable for dealing with phazers like Iron Hands and Hippowdon, or a Good as Gold user like Skeledirge or Gholdengo can block phazing moves outright.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
Tera Fairy allows Orthworm to resist Fighting-type attacks and wall foes like Slither Wing, Lucario, and Hawlucha.

Tera Ghost retains the greater matchup vs the aforementioned Fighting-types while also being immune to Staraptor's Double Edge and Gengar's Focus Blast. Tera Ghost also allows Orthworm to spin block and threaten out Tsareena and Donphan.

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: Tera Ghost allows Orthworm to spinblock against foes like Tsareena while setting up entry hazards. Tera Ghost also prevents Slither Wing, Lucario, and Gallade from hitting Orthworm super effectively, allowing it to safely pass a Shed Tail. However, it is much more advisable to Terastallize a different threat as Orthworm will be nearly out of comission after a single Shed Tail.

sets.name: Suicide Lead
sets.description:
• Glimmora stands out as one of the best suicide leads in the metagame thanks to its signature ability in Toxic Debris and great utility movepool consisting of Stealth Rock, Spikes, and Memento. Its high Special Attack alongside STAB and coverage options in Power Gem and Earth Power let it threaten most foes including Miraidon, Iron Bundle, and Iron Treads.
  • Tera Ghost Glimmora prevents common spinners like Iron Treads and Great Tusk from removing the entry hazards that Glimmora sets. Glimmora also benefits from Tera Ghost removing its 4x weakness to Ground-type attacks, letting it threaten these spinners with its coverage more reliably. However, given the nature of Glimmora as a dedicated lead, Terastallizing is not generally recommended.
  • Dazzling Gleam threatens Fighting-types like Koraidon and Great Tusk, as well as Miraidon. Its signature move, Mortal Spin, lets Glimmora act as an entry hazard remover and also cripples Stealth Rock setters like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk with poison.
  • Mortal Spin is a good option when facing setup sweepers that Glimmora cannot threaten if it doesn't have the right coverage like Swords Dance + Flame Charge Koraidon, Double Dance Miraidon, and Bulk Up Annihilape.
  • Memento allows a teammate to come in easily while also preventing entry hazard removal attempts.
  • Glimmora likes offensive staples like Miraidon and Koraidon that can take advantage of the entry hazards it sets up. They both threaten to OHKO Defog Corviknight.
  • Glimmora also appreciates Ghost-types such as Annihilape, Flutter Mane, and Gholdengo, while they appreciate the entry hazards that Glimmora sets.

sets.name: Debris Lead
sets.description:
• With a solid early-game Speed tier, utility, high Special Attack, and decent coverage options, Glimmora can set the tone of a battle, sometimes scoring KOs before fulfilling its main role of setting entry hazards.

  • Mud Shot will fail to KO many foes—most notably other Glimmora—but it is a valuable form of speed control that can immediately turn the game in your favor.

  • Memento is a key piece of Glimmora's potential utility, as it immediately makes way for a devastating sweeper to set up against foes with halved offensive stats and potentially lowered Speed.

Tera Types

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type is an option to absorb Spore from Breloom, but given the set's purpose, this is generally not recommended.

sets.name: Scrappy Choice Item
sets.description:
• Scrappy gives Flamigo a unique niche, letting it throw out powerful Close Combats that are unsafe for Gholdengo and Dragapult to take!

  • Throat Chop is a decent filler move, letting Flamigo shut down Sylveon's Hyper Voice and Skeledirge's Torch Song. Note that Close Combat still does more damage to most Ghost-types.

  • Tailwind is a filler move that gives Flamigo's team some extreme speed control before it goes down.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting lets Flamigo fully take advantage of Scrappy, giving Choice Scarf sets a 81.3% chance to OHKO offensive Dragapult.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Flamigo immune to Will-O-Wisp, letting Choice Band sets more easily break through Skeledirge, and gives Flamigo the option to 2HKO Corviknight with Tera Blast.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Flamigo outspeeds major threats such as Dragapult and Hydreigon, making it a more effective late-game cleaner.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Flamigo deal massive damage, giving it a shot at 2HKOing Skeledirge with Close Combat.

sets.name: OHKO Fisher
sets.description:
• With immense bulk, Yawn, and Unaware, Dondozo is not only an impressive defensive Pokemon, but one of the most dangerous OHKO fishers in the game.

  • Despite the recoil, Wave Crash is the prefered option over Liquidation in most cases, purely for the damage output.

  • Protect is not only useful for scouting for unexpected Tera types, but pairs well with Yawn and Leftovers to give Dondozo more longevity.

  • It can be tricky to fit in, but Avalanche can be used to deal more consistent damage against Dragon-types.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type lets Dondozo take on powerful Dragon-type attacks much more easily, and is just a good defensive typing in general.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type is useful enough for covering Dondozo's weaknesses, and the Spore immunity makes it capable of beating Breloom too.

  • Flying: Flying may seem like an odd Tera type, but it can lead to your Dondozo winning mirror matches thanks to the Fissure immunity.

EV Spreads

  • 252 Def / 252 SpD / 4 Spe: With Dondozo's massive HP stat, it's still able to take physical hits fairly well with this spread, while making it feasible to Yawn against special attacking threats such as Choice Scarf Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe: This more extreme spread helps against powerful Tera users, with the ability to avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult's Dragon Darts with Leftovers. This comes at the cost of being much more vulnerable to weaker special attackers.

sets.name: BIG FLOPPA (Assault Vest)
sets.description:
• Dondozo’s good power and bulk lend it nicely to an Assault Vest set.

  • Avalanche punishes Flying- and Dragon-types with super effective coverage.

  • Body Press is valuable Fighting-type coverage for most foes that would otherwise be a good switch in to Dondozo, such as Meowscarada, Magnezone, and Kingambit.

  • Fissure allows Dondozo to potentially cheese its way through something that might otherwise wall it.

  • Earthquake offers more reliable Ground-type coverage at the cost of not being an instant KO like Fissure.

  • Tera Blast can provide a valuable secondary STAB for tera Dondozo.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Dondozo’s usual set of weaknesses and allows it to absorb spore from the likes of Amoonguss and Breloom.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy grants Dondozo a new set of resistances to take advantage of with its phenominal bulk and also grants it a powerful STAB to hit Dragon- and Fighting-types with if it runs Tera Blast.

  • Ground: Terastallizing into a Ground-type allows Dondozo to block the Electric-type attacks commonly aimed at it while also giving it STAB on Earthquake.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon gives Dondozo a resistance to both Electric- and Water-type attacks, allowing it to stand up to Rotom-W much better.

  • Dark: Tera Dark allows Dondozo to better check Espathra by becoming immune to Lumina Crash and Stored Power.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
• With Unaware, Dondozo becomes an effective and difficult to break Curse user.

  • Even with Curse being the point of this set, Dondozo can still effectively fish for OHKOs with Fissure when it's not in a favorable set-up position.

  • Many foes will Terrastallize into a Flying-type to avoid an expected Fissure, which makes Avalanche a particularly useful coverage move.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: The Dragon immunity that Tera Fairy provides makes setting up on powerful foes like Choice Band Dragapult much easier.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera Type, Dondozo can effectively set up on Breloom.

  • Flying: If using Fissure, Tera Flying is a good choice for potentially beating other Dondozo.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Dondozo is a great defensive Pokemon with its high physical bulk and typing, which allows it to wall physical attackers such as Zacian-C and Groudon. Spikes supports offensive teammates, while Haze stops foes like Swords Dance Zacian-C and Tidy Up Groudon from setting up. Knock Off removes items such as Covert Cloak and Leftovers, and Scald burns provide chip damage on foes. Flip Turn makes it easier to pivot into offensive teammates such as Miraidon, since Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce don't block it; alternatively, Parting Shot makes the foe easier to handle for Dondozo's teammates, but it's stopped by Taunt and Good as Gold. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves such as U-turn and V-create. Covert Cloak protects against secondary effects like confusion from Zacian-C's Magical Torque and burns from Scald. Tera Fire allows Dondozo to resist Magical Torque and Grass-type moves from Zacian-C, and it maintains Dondozo's resistance to Fire-type moves such as V-create. Dondozo appreciates defensive teammates with typing synergy such as RegenVest Ting-Lu, which helps protect Dondozo from threatening Pokemon such as Miraidon.

sets.name: Prankster
sets.description: Prankster Dondozo with Haze can reliably check physical setup sweepers such as Zacian-C and Groudon thanks to its huge physical bulk. Entrainment forces out Pokemon dependent on their abilities, Encore can lock foes into unfavorable moves such as setup moves or V-create, and Glare debilitates fast attackers such as Zacian-C and Palkia-O. Parting Shot allows Dondozo to maintain momentum against opposing threats such as Miraidon with its priority pivoting and attack stat reduction, making it easier for teammates such as Ting-Lu to take hits from them; alternatively, Flip Turn provides a pivoting option unaffected by Taunt, Dark-types, and Magic Bounce. Heavy-Duty Boots, notably eases Dondozo's pivoting, while Covert Cloak protects it from status conditions from moves such as Nuzzle, Mortal Spin, and Magical Torque. Tera Fire improves Dondozo's matchup against Zacian-C with Grass-type coverage and lets it resist V-create and Magical Torque, whereas Tera Dark makes Dondozo immune to status moves from other Prankster users and improves its matchup against Ghost- and Dark-types. RegenVest Hisuian Goodra, Ting-Lu, and Fur Coat users synergize with Dondozo, covering threats such as Zacian-C, Groudon, and Palkia-O.

sets.name: Bulky Taunt
sets.description:
• With Vital Spirit, Annihilape can absorb Breloom's Spore; in addition to being immune to Breloom's Mach Punch, it can set up with Bulk Up and then recover the damage taken from Bullet Seed with Drain Punch.

  • Taunt helps you deal with annoying Pokemon like Curse Dondozo, Will-O-Wisp Skeledirge, and Hippowdon, to mention a few, forcing them to attack and boost Rage Fist.

Tera Types

  • Steel Steel turns Annihilape's Psychic and Fairy weakness into resistances, as well as being an excellent defensive type overall. It lets Annihilape set up freely on Amoonguss, and resisting Flower Trick means Meowscarada has a much harder time revenge killing it.

  • Water: Water doesn't let Annihilape resist one of its weaknesses, but Water is the better general-purpose defensive type. It notably reduces damage from the powerful Choice Band Palafin-H.

  • Flying: Flying helps a lot to avoid Dondozo's Fissure, forcing it to attack with moves that boost Rage Fist.

  • Fire: In addition to giving a useful resistance to Fairy attacks, Tera Fire also prevents Will-O-Wisp from hitting.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak makes Annihilape immune to being Salt Cured, making it a great check against Garganacl. It also gives peace of mind, removing potential flinches from Hydreigon's Dark Pulse.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's residual recovery comes in handy if a different Pokemon is using Covert Cloak.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximum Speed mainly helps Annihilape outspeed Gholdengo and Breloom. With Bulk Up and Rage Fist improving its offense, Annihilape can invest in HP over Attack.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: More special bulk can make it much more difficult for special attackers to revenge kill Annihilape.

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and Cloyster while still giving Annihilape good special bulk.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Annihilape has enough Speed to surprise important threats with Choice Scarf, such as Dragapult and Meowscarada.

  • Shadow Claw is weak, but it's a reliable Ghost-type STAB move. If you can manage to get Annihilape into a weak attack, though, Rage Fist has much more reward associated with it.

  • Ice Punch deals massive damage to Garchomp and Dragonite, making them easier to pick off or pressuring them to Terastallize.

  • If using maximum HP, Final Gambit can potentially OHKO major defensive threats if Annihilape is healthy, such as Garganacl and Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: With a Fighting Tera type, Close Combat does outrageous damage, with Rotom-W in particular taking over 90% from it.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type makes Shadow Claw OHKO Dragapult, as well as giving it a 56.3% chance of OHKOing 4 HP Gholdengo.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: This simple EV spread is best when not using Final Gambit to maximize offensive power.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Spe: While maximizing HP makes Annihilape a less reliable revenge killer, it can effectively sacrifice itself with Final Gambit to get surprise KOs on certain defensive foes, like Corviknight and Garganacl.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: The immunity to Spore gives Annihilape a good opportunity to switch into Breloom, and it need not worry about Yawn.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate is not particularly common, punishing that and Speed drops can lead to devastating surprise sweeps.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description: This set has no write-up in progress yet. If you have experience with this set, feel free to reserve it here.

vgc2023.overview:
• Annihilape is a great Bulk Up user in Series 1 thanks to its unresisted STAB combination, good bulk, Rage Fist, and Defiant, which stops Attack drops from slowing down its clean up.

  • It can also utilize Choice Scarf to good effect, using Final Gambit as an immediate one-on-one trade option.

  • Rage Fist increases in power every time Annihilape is hit, making it a deadly move during longer games thanks to its good natural bulk.

  • Annihilape sports positive matchups versus much of the metagame, including, but not limited to, Maushold, Hydreigon, and Meowscarada. Additionally, its Defiant can be used to deter Intimidate Pokemon such as Arcanine and Gyarados, allowing strong ally physical attackers such as Garchomp and Gyarados to thrive.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• To set up with Bulk Up safely, Annihilape enjoys dual screens and redirection support from Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl and Amoonguss.

  • Tera Blast is used to KO Steel-types Drain Punch does not hit super effectively, such as Gholdengo, without relying on Rage Fist being boosted.

  • The Fire Tera type gives Annihilape an immunity to Will-O-Wisp from Pokemon like Rotom-W and Talonflame and a key resistance to Fairy and neutrality to Ghost and Psychic, useful against opposing Annihilape, Meowscarada, and Armarouge. Furthermore, it lets Annihilape effectively combat Trick Room because, when played under dual screens, Annihilape can counter major Trick Room threats like Hatterene and Tera Fire Torkoal. Alternatively, picking Tera Water focuses on defensive advantages, primarily resistances to Steel- and Fire-type moves such as Gholdengo's Make it Rain and Torkoal's STAB moves.

  • Vital Spirit can be used instead of Defiant for mainly Amoonguss, but also other sleep move users like Yawn Sylveon and Hypnosis Gothitelle.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• This set is used commonly on Trick Room teams. Annihilape outspeeding most Pokemon, OHKOing them with Final Gambit, and being immune to Fake Out helps teammates like Hatterene and Armarouge set Trick Room, and fainting gives a free switch-in to a slow Trick Room beneficiary such as Tera Fire Torkoal. U-turn provides a switch-in without sacrificing Annihilape, and, while it doesn't OHKO, it hits common Pokemon such as Oranguru and Indeedee-F for large amounts of damage.

  • Shadow Claw is a consistent damage-dealing option that doesn't rely on foes to power it up. However, Rage Fist can still be utilized effectively thanks to Annihilape's bulk. Phantom Force avoids attacks and ignores protecting moves, giving Annihilape opportunities to deal unavoidable damage.

  • While not normally Terastallized, Annihilape can use Tera Ghost to remove its Fairy weakness and give a huge boost to its Ghost-type move, which becomes able to heavily dent much of the metagame.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• While Clodsire is lacking in physical bulk compared to Dondozo and Skeledirge, it makes up for it in having a fantastic support movepool.

  • Yawn is very effective at forcing switches, which is especially dangerous if Stealth Rock is set up.

  • Poison Jab is Clodsire's best move against Tera Fairy Rotom-W, which is an especially important target when using Water Absorb.

  • Protect, in addition to benefiting from Leftovers, pairs well with Yawn.

  • Body Press isn't particularly strong, but it does prevent Clodsire from being totally walled by Tera Steel Hydreigon if using a physically defensive spread.

  • Black Sludge may seem appealing, but it punishes Clodsire for Terastalliizing unless it becomes Tera Poison, so Leftovers is preferred unless Leftovers is already on something else.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, Clodsire no longer has to worry about Earthquake or Fissure.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type allows Clodsire to take on powerful Dragon-type attacks, without the worry of Gholdengo dealing massive damage.

  • Poison: With Tera Poison, Clodsire not only becomes a better check to Grass- and Water-types such as Meowscarda and Rotom-W, but it can also safely run Black Sludge to punish users of Trick.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type will stop powerful Dragon-type attacks cold without making Clodsire weak to Earthquake, but it comes at the cost of compromising its ability to check Gholdengo.

  • Dark: Espathra's Stored Power is a big issue for Clodsire, so Tera Dark can flip the tables on it.

Abilities

  • Unaware: If you're planning to use Clodsire to its fullest defensive potential, Unaware is the best bet against setup foes.

  • Water Absorb: Water Absorb sacrifices overall defensive potential in exchange for being able to wall Rotom-W without needing to Terastallize. If setting up Stealth Rock is important, this can be worth it.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is Clodsire's best hope for handling powerful special attackers such as Choice Specs Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Clodsire's Defense may be mediocre, but with maximum investment, it can pull stunts such as usually avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Dragonite's Outrage with Leftovers.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: With huge HP and Special Defense stats, Clodsire makes use of Ice Scales to serve as a strong special wall, or it can instead function as a versatile support Pokemon that utilizes Prankster to cripple opposing Pokemon and deter setup. Toxic allows Clodsire to wear down opposing walls, while Toxic Spikes punishes switching and and cripples pivoting foes; Poison Jab is a final option to hit Noivern and still spread status. Spikes and Stealth Rock are both good options for additional entry hazards, with Spikes damage stacking with Toxic Spikes poison and Stealth Rock punishing Flying-types switching into Clodsire. Haze is another option that lets Clodsire stop threatening setup sweepers like Volcarona, though it should almost always be run on Prankster variants. Frail offensive teammates like Iron Bundle and Iron Valiant appreciate Clodsire's ability to soak up strong special attacks, and Clodsire appreciates them taking out foes it's too passive to handle on its own. Clodsire also has below average Defense, so it benefits from being paired with physically defensive teammates like Fur Coat Corviknight and Avalugg.

vgc2023.overview:
• Farigiraf is currently one of the bulkiest Trick Room setters in the meta. Its ability, Armor Tail, prevents its teammates from succumbing to priority moves, making it difficult to prevent Farigiraf from setting Trick Room.

  • Hariyama, Amoonguss, and Kingambit are good partners for Farigiraf. Hariyama and Farigiraf both benefit from each other, as Fake Out allows Farigiraf to more consistently get up Trick Room, which enables Hariyama, as it thrives inside of Trick Room and checks Farigiraf's common counters. Amoonguss can redirect moves targeted at Farigiraf and Spore anything inside Trick Room to take them out of the game. Kingambit benefits from the Snarl that Farigiraf struggles against and plays well in Trick Room.

  • Choice Band Meowscarada and Hydreigon are the biggest checks to Farigiraf, as both threaten to OHKO it. Amoonguss is another check, as it can Spore Farigiraf before it manages to get Trick Room up. It also struggles against Imprison from Indeedee, Gallade, and opposing Farigiraf.

sets.name: Bulky Trick Room
sets.description:
• Hyper Voice is a decently strong Normal-type STAB move for Farigiraf to spread chip damage that softens up opponents for its allies. Psyshock tackles common Psychic-weak Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Gengar, whereas Dazzling Gleam improves its matchup into common checks like Meowscarada and Hydreigon. Helping Hand allows Farigiraf to supplement a harder hitting teammate's damage output. Imprison is used on fast offensive teams that would otherwise struggle against opposing Trick Room teams.

  • Safety Goggles provides an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss and Breloom, who would otherwise prevent Trick Room from going up with it. Sitrus Berry gives Farigiraf longevity with recovery. Colbur Berry allows Farigiraf to consistently get Trick Room up in the face of Meowscarada and Hydreigon.

  • For other notable items, Mental Herb prevents fast Taunt users like Talonflame from interrupting Farigiraf's Trick Room. Life Orb or Throat Spray are good options to improve Farigiraf's already decent damage output. Rocky Helmet can also be used for an answer to unsuspecting Maushold.

  • 180 EVs in HP allow Farigiraf to survive maximum HP Annihilape Final Gambit, and the defensive investment allows it to always survive Tera Steel Choice Specs Gholdengo Make It Rain and Focus Sash Meowscarada Knock Off.

  • Tera Fairy is more of a defensive Tera type, giving it a resistance to all the types that Farigiraf was previously weak to while gaining STAB on Dazzling Gleam. Tera Normal adds damage onto Hyper Voice and removes its Dark weakness.
